units.title: Day 1: Introduction to HTML and Basic Structure
lessons: Setting up your environment (Text editors, browsers)
Basic HTML structure (DOCTYPE, html, head, body tags)
Writing your first HTML document and displaying it in a browser
outcomes: Understand the fundamental purpose of HTML.
Set up a development environment for writing and viewing HTML.
Create a basic HTML document with the essential structural tags.
Distinguish between HTML elements and attributes.

units.title: Day 2: Text Formatting and Semantic Elements
lessons: Semantic elements (article, aside, nav, header, footer, section)
outcomes: Format text using heading and paragraph tags.
Apply emphasis and importance to text using semantic tags.
Utilize line breaks and horizontal rules for visual structure.
Understand and implement semantic elements to improve HTML structure and SEO.

units.title: Day 3: Lists and Links
lessons: Creating hyperlinks (a tag - href, target attributes)
Linking to internal and external resources
Anchor links (linking to specific sections within a page)
outcomes: Create different types of lists to organize information.
Create hyperlinks to connect to other web pages and resources.
Implement internal and external links effectively.
Use anchor links to navigate within a single webpage.

units.title: Day 4: Images and Media
lessons: Inserting images (img tag - src, alt attributes)
Adding video (video tag - src, controls, width, height)
outcomes: Embed images into web pages using the `img` tag.
Choose the appropriate image format for different use cases.
Control the size and placement of images.
Embed video and audio into web pages using the `video` and `audio` tags.
Understand the basics of providing alternative text and captions for accessibility.

units.title: Day 5: Tables
lessons: Creating tables (table, tr, th, td tags)
Spanning rows and columns (rowspan, colspan attributes)
outcomes: Construct tables to display data in a structured format.
Utilize table headers, rows, and data cells effectively.
Span rows and columns to create complex table layouts.
Add a descriptive caption to tables.

units.title: Day 6: Forms - Input Types
lessons: Creating forms (form tag - action, method attributes)
Input types (text, password, email, number, date, checkbox, radio, file)
Labeling form elements (label tag - for attribute)
Using the 'name' attribute for form data submission
outcomes: Create HTML forms to collect user input.
Utilize different input types to gather various forms of data.
Properly label form elements for accessibility and usability.
Set placeholder text and require specific fields.

units.title: Day 7: Forms - Other Elements and Attributes
outcomes: Implement textareas for multi-line text input.
Create select dropdowns to provide users with a list of options.
Create different types of buttons for form submission and other actions.
Organize form elements into fieldsets with legends.
Utilize form validation attributes to ensure data integrity.

units.title: Day 8: Divs and Spans
lessons: Using divs for layout and structure
Using spans for styling inline elements
Introduction to the concept of CSS classes and IDs
outcomes: Differentiate between block-level and inline elements.
Use divs to create structural sections within a webpage.
Use spans to style specific inline text elements.
Nest divs and spans to achieve complex layouts.
Understand the basic principles of applying CSS classes and IDs to HTML elements.

units.title: Day 9: HTML5 Semantic Elements (Advanced)
lessons: More in-depth look at article, aside, nav, header, footer, section, main
When and how to use these elements effectively
Accessibility best practices for semantic elements
outcomes: Confidently use HTML5 semantic elements to create well-structured and accessible web pages.
Understand the specific purpose of each element and how it contributes to the overall meaning of the content.
Apply semantic elements to improve SEO and accessibility.

units.title: Day 10: Review and Project
lessons: Review of all HTML concepts covered
Practice Project: Building a basic webpage from scratch (e.g., a simple personal portfolio or a product page)
Debugging and troubleshooting common HTML errors
Resources for further learning (HTML documentation, online courses)
outcomes: Reinforce understanding of all HTML concepts covered in the past 9 days.
Apply acquired knowledge to build a functional webpage.
Develop problem-solving skills for debugging HTML code.
Identify resources for continued learning and improvement.
